hackathon-description-text: DEP is proud to announce our 2nd Annual Hackathon event, in partnership with
hackathon-eligibility: Anyone or any team that is looking to help solve social and community problems with a digital outcome. We are looking for participants to select and understand a particular community problem and develop ideas to solve it. This is not about coding or programming, but about problem solving.
hackathon-requirements:
We recommend your submissions and presentations be in powerpoint or Prezi format. Submissions must have:
Nice to haves, but not required:
hackathon-rules:
-          9:00a | Registration and Coffee
-          10:00a | Introductions
-          10:30a | Break Into Teams and Begin
-          12:30p | Lunch Arrives, Campisis Pizza. You may purchase your own elsewhere
-          6:00p |  Hackathon Ends
-          6:10p |  Presentations Begin
-          7:00p |  Contest Winners Announced
-          8:00p |  After-Party at Craft & Growler

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First place team will receive $500.00 cash.
Second place team will receive $300.00 cash.
Third place team will receive $200.00 cash.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=500 North Akard Street, Dallas, TX 75201, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the team clearly define the problem and the solution?
Is it well-designed and functional? Does it solve the identified problem?

Is this a project delivered via an electronic means?
- A score of 5 would be a mobile or web app
- A score of 3 would be a web video or presentation
- A score of 1 would be little or no technology component
Does the demo/project enact an immediate or near-term change or outcome?

Do you expect this project to have extended influence by way of a likely champion or adopting stakeholder? Does it propose a solution that is scalable? Is it built in conjunction or partnership with existing projects or ideas, such as open-source code?

hackathon-location-address: 500 North Akard Street, Dallas, TX 75201, USA
